newsitem.title: SWEDEN: P&U says bourse clears phone conference.
newsitem.headline: P&U says bourse clears phone conference.

text.p: Swedish-U.S. drugs Pharmacia & Upjohn (P&U) said on Wednesday a Stockholm bourse investigation about an anlysts' telephone conference on October 31 concluded that the company did not break regulations.
The exchange said the company should follow information regulations of the New York Stock Exchange as the share has its primary listing there, according to the company.
But P&U added that it shared the Stockholm exchange's view that when information affecting the share price is given, it should be released through a press statement.

During a phone conference with analysts, connected with P&U's release of third quarter earnings, a company official said analysts needed to lower their full-year forecasts for earnings per share by 10 cents.
This information caused the company's share to tumble in Stockholm while several market players were unaware of the reason for the fall.
The New York Stock Exchange was closed at the time of the telephone conference.
